DOC.brief_title: Time Oseltamivir Access When Prescribed Pharmacists Versus Physicians ( ACCESS )
DOC.criteria: Inclusion Criteria Group 1 1 . Male female subject ≥ 18 year age present pharmacy current prescription oseltamivir ( 75 mg capsule BID 5 day per Canadian label ) treatment current influenza symptom 2 . Willingness undergo 2 nasal swab procedure 3 . Willingness participate study evidence write sign Informed Consent Form Inclusion Criteria Group 2 1 . Male female subject ≥ 18 year age present pharmacy indicative clinical symptoms/signs uncomplicated acute illness due influenza infection start within maximum 2 day prior visit pharmacy ( see Appendix A : FACTSS Influenza Diagnostic Tool ) 2 . Suitable oseltamivir treatment dose 75 mg BID ( see Appendix B : Algorithm Determining Suitability Pharmacist Prescribing Oseltamivir ) 3 . Willingness undergo 2 nasal swab procedure 4 . Willingness pay ( covered insurance ) receive treatment oseltamivir 5 . Willingness participate study evidence write sign Informed Consent Form Exclusion Criteria Group 1 1 . Subjects prescribe formulation ( i.e. , oral suspension ) dose regimen oseltamivir , antiviral medication treatment influenza 2 . Individuals present pharmacy oseltamivir prescription currently diagnosis influenza ( e.g. , individual fill prescription someone else currently infect influenza ; individual fill prescription someone else use prevention influenza infection treatment future influenza infection ) 3 . Subjects receive oseltamivir prescription physician participate study 4 . Subjects oseltamivir prescription fill reason 5 . Subjects , opinion research personnel , comply study procedures 6 . Staff pharmacy primary care clinic involve study , family member Exclusion Criteria Group 2 1 . Subjects already start treatment antiviral medication current influenza symptom 2 . Subjects oseltamivir prescription fill reason 3 . Subjects , opinion investigator , suitable study clinical reason ( e.g. , patient require hospitalisation able comply study procedure ) 4 . Staff pharmacy primary care clinic involve study , family member
